title: Earth from Space: Paris in focus
summary: This striking high-resolution image offers an in-depth view of central Paris, allowing you to explore and zoom into the city’s most captivating areas in exceptional detail.

title: Falcon 9 cleared to resume launches
summary: SpaceX is ready to resume launches of its Falcon 9 rocket as soon as July 27 after completing an investigation into an upper stage anomaly two weeks earlier.

title: U.S. military urged to embrace smallsat revolution
summary: Mitchell Institute report: Now is the time for the United States to fully leverage the unique attributes of small satellites

title: Starliner Tests Still Underway, No Date for Butch and Suni’s Return
summary: NASA and Boeing provided an update on the Starliner Crew Flight Test today. They are still conducting tests to determine why the Starliner commercial crew capsule experienced thruster failures and […]

title: Make-or-break tests on tap for Boeing’s Starliner capsule
summary: Critical tests are on tap this weekend to confirm Boeing's Starliner capsule can safety carry its two-person crew back to Earth despite unexpected helium leaks and degraded maneuvering thrusters, officials said Thursday.

title: SpaceX Submits FAA Mishap Report, Falcon 9 Set For Return To Flight
summary: SpaceX Submits FAA Mishap Report, Falcon 9 Set For Return To Flight

title: Morpheus expands production in new Dresden factory
summary: SAN FRANCISCO – Morpheus Space is ramping up electric propulsion production in its new Dresden, Germany, factory. In the 1,260-square-meter factory, Morpheus will initially produce 100 GO-2 Field Emission Electric […]

title: AST SpaceMobile ready to ship first commercial satellites for SpaceX launch
summary: TAMPA, Fla. — AST SpaceMobile’s first five commercial direct-to-smartphone satellites are ready to be shipped to Cape Canaveral in a few weeks, the company said July 25 in anticipation of a […]

title: NASA’s Orion Spacecraft Gets Lift on Earth
summary: Crane operator Rebekah Tolatovicz, a shift mechanical technician lead for Artic Slope Regional Corporation at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, operates a 30-ton crane to lift the agency’s Artemis II Orion spacecraft out of the recently renovated altitude chamber to the Final Assembly and Systems Testing, or FAST, cell inside NASA Kennedy’s Neil A. title: NASA Selects Marshall Logistics Support Services II Contractor
summary: NASA has awarded the MSFC Logistics Support Services II (MLSS II) contract to Akima Global Logistics, LLC to provide logistics support services at the agency’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. The performance-based indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract has a maximum potential value of $96.3 million. The contract begins on Sunday, Sept. 1 with a one-year base […]
